intro: Microcos latistipulata, commonly known as the broad-leaf microcos, is a species of flowering plant in the Malvaceae family. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa, particularly in countries like Kenya and Tanzania. The plant is characterized by its broad, ovate leaves and showy, pale yellow to white flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in savanna and woodland habitats. The plant's botanical features make it an important component of its native ecosystems.
